column4: HP says it will cut up to 30 000 jobs
column5: Hewlett-Packard Co   which is splitting into two listed companies later this year  said it expects to cut another 25 000 to 30 000 jobs in its enterprise business as part of its efforts to save $2.7 billion in costs.

column4: HP says to cut 25 000 to 30 000 jobs in enterprise business
column5: Sept 15 Hewlett-Packard Co said it expects to cut 25 000 to 30 000 jobs as part of its restructuring and cost-saving efforts at it enterprise services business.

column4: MOVES-HSBC appoints Rafael Moral Santiago as head of securities services  Europe
column5: LONDON  Sept 15 HSBC said on Tuesday it had appointed Rafael Moral Santiago as head of securities services for Europe.

column4: MOVES-HSBC appoints Rafael Moral Santiago as head of securities services  Europe
column5: LONDON  Sept 15 HSBC said on Tuesday it had appointed Rafael Moral Santiago as head of securities services for Europe.

column4: MOVES-JPMorgan  BNY Mellon  BlackRock  HSBC  Prudential
column5: Sept 15 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Tuesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: JPMorgan sued over debit cards issued to released convicts
column5: A former convict who attracted national attention for his prison art has filed a proposed class action against JPMorgan Chase  accusing the largest U.S. bank of charging exorbitant fees for debit cards issued to federal inmates when they are released.

column4: MOVES-JPMorgan names ex-Goldman banker Huang head of China global banking
column5: HONG KONG  Sept 15 JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Tuesday it hired ex-Goldman Sachs banker Houston Huang as head of Global Investment Banking China  betting on continued growth in the world's second largest economy.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Sept 15 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: Kellogg to spend $450 million to expand in Africa
column5: Kellogg Co  is setting up a joint venture with the African arm of Singapore's Tolaram Group to bolster its breakfast and snack food offerings in West Africa.

column4: UPDATE 1-Kellogg to spend $450 mln to expand in Africa
column5: Sept 15 Kellogg Co is setting up a joint venture with the African arm of Singapore's Tolaram Group to bolster its breakfast and snack food offerings in West Africa.

column4: Kellogg to spend $450 mln to expand in Africa
column5: Sept 15 Kellogg Co said it would buy a 50 percent stake in Lagos  Nigeria-based Multipro  a sales and distribution unit owned by Singapore's Tolaram Group  for $450 million.

column4: Philips forecasts "modest" sales growth in 2016
column5: AMSTERDAM  Sept 15 Philips  said on Tuesday that it is on track to spin off its lighting division next year  but the Dutch group expects only lacklustre sales growth in 2016.

column4: U.S. Air Force says too early to speculate on possible sale of ULA
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Md.  Sept 15 The U.S. Air Force on Tuesday said it would carefully review any proposed sale of United Launch Alliance (ULA)  a 50-50 rocket launch venture of Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co to Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc.

column4: GE among bidders for Halliburton's assets -Bloomberg
column5: Sept 14 General Electric Co is bidding for pieces of Halliburton Co's drilling services and drilling bits businesses  as the latter works to get regulatory approval to buy Baker Hughes Inc  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Fitch Upgrades Daiwa to 'A-'; Affirms Nomura at 'A-'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) TOKYO/HONG KONG  September 15 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has upgraded the Long-Term  Issuer Default Ratings (IDRs) of Daiwa Securities Group Inc. (Daiwa Securities  Group) and its wholly owned subsidiary  Daiwa Securities Co. Ltd. (Daiwa  Securities) to 'A-' from 'BBB+'. Fitch has also affirmed the Long-Term IDRs of  Nomura Holdings  Inc. (Nomura Holdings) and of its wholly owned subsidiaries  Nomura Securities Co.  Ltd. (Nomura Securities)

column4: Analysts bet Novo's insulin drug will get U.S. green light
column5: COPENHAGEN Analysts are confident the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will soon approve Novo Nordisk's new long-lasting insulin drug Tresiba -- just as they were before the drug was first rebuffed two years ago.

column4: Analysts bet Novo's insulin drug will get U.S. green light
column5: COPENHAGEN  Sept 15 Analysts are confident the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will soon approve Novo Nordisk's new long-lasting insulin drug Tresiba -- just as they were before the drug was first rebuffed two years ago.

column4: BRIEF-Novo Nordisk releases new diabetes drug studies
column5: * Says new data confirm Tresiba U200 delivers significantly lower rates of confirmed hypoglycaemia versus insulin glargine U100

column4: UPDATE 1-PBF planning to restart Chalmette refinery hydrocracker -sources
column5: HOUSTON  Sept 14 PBF Energy Inc plans to restart a 20 000 barrel-per-day (bpd) hydrocracking unit  perhaps as early as late 2016  at the 192 500-bpd refinery in Chalmette  Louisiana  of which the company is scheduled to take possession by the end of this year  said sources familiar with PBF's plans.

column4: Indebted emerging world about to count cost of Fed rate rise
column5: LONDON  Sept 15 Sometime this year  possibly even this week  the U.S. Federal Reserve will add billions of dollars to the annual cost of borrowing. Many firms  especially in emerging markets  seem ill-prepared for the inevitable.

column4: UPDATE 2-Petrobras chairman to take leave  to focus on job as Vale CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 14 Murilo Ferreira will take a leave of absence as chairman of state-run oil firm Petrobras  turning his full attention to his job as chief executive officer of Vale SA as the mining company grapples with a downturn in the sector.

column4: BRIEF-Norway's Yara to sell its European CO2 business to U.S Praxair  sees gain of EUR 150 mln
column5: * Says signs a non-binding agreement with U.S.-based Praxair  Inc. to sell its European CO2 business for 218 million euros.

column4: Prudential appoints former head of regulator as non-executive director
column5: LONDON  Sept 15 British insurer Prudential  said on Tuesday it had appointed Adair Turner  the former head of the country's financial services regulator  as a non-executive director.

column4: BRIEF-Prudential appoints Jonathan Turner and David Law as non-exec directors
column5: * Appointment of Jonathan Turner and David Law as non-executive directors

column4: UPDATE 1-Schlumberger bid for Eurasia stake could face new conditions -RIA
column5: * Schlumberger's bid for EDC still to be cleared by Russian govt

column4: Russia may toughen requirements for Schlumberger's bid for Eurasia Drilling - RIA
column5: MOSCOW  Sept 15 Russian government may put forward some additional requirements for Schlumberger's  attempted bid to acquire a part of Eurasia Drilling  servicing company  RIA news agency quoted the head of anti-monopoly watchdog as saying on Tuesday.

column4: Sony  Olympus to unveil high-definition endoscope
column5: Sony Corp and Olympus Corp said they plan to unveil an ultra high-definition surgical endoscope this week  the first major product from a joint venture formed three years ago.

column4: Sony  Olympus to unveil high-definition endoscope
column5: Sept 15 Sony Corp and Olympus Corp  said they plan to unveil an ultra high-definition surgical endoscope this week  the first major product from a joint venture formed three years ago.

column4: Nine of world's biggest banks join to form blockchain partnership
column5: LONDON Nine of the world's biggest banks including Goldman Sachs and Barclays have joined forces with New York-based financial tech firm R3 to create a framework for using blockchain technology in the markets  the firm said on Tuesday.

column4: Nine of world's biggest banks join to form blockchain partnership
column5: LONDON  Sept 15 Nine of the world's biggest banks including Goldman Sachs and Barclays have joined forces with New York-based financial tech firm R3 to create a framework for using blockchain technology in the markets  the firm said on Tuesday.

column4: Sysco targets $400 million in annual operating income growth by 2018
column5: NEW YORK Sysco Corp said on Tuesday it is targeting at least $400 million in annual operating income growth by 2018 as the food distributor aims to increase deliveries to local  independent restaurants amid increased competition.

column4: U.S. judge certifies class action over Target Corp data breach
column5: A U.S. judge on Tuesday certified a class action against Target Corp  brought by several banks over the retailer's massive data breach in 2013.

column4: Target challenges Amazon  enters grocery delivery with Instacart
column5: CHICAGO Target Corp said on Tuesday it has partnered with Instacart Inc to deliver groceries for as little as $3.99 per order  as it overhauls its food business and competes with Amazon.com Inc's grocery delivery service.

column4: UPDATE 1-Vivendi could raise its Telecom Italia stake - Les Echos
column5: PARIS  Sept 15 French media company Vivendi  could raise its 15.5 percent stake in Telecom Italia  again  possibly to about 20 percent of the capital  French daily Les Echos said on Tuesday.

column4: Vivendi could raise Telecom Italia's stake further - Les Echos

column4: Brazil's TIM sticking to investment plan despite currency drop
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 15 Brazilian telecom company TIM Participações SA will stick to its investment plan  denominated in reais  despite a more than 30 percent drop in Brazil's currency this year  Chief Executive Rodrigo Abreu told analysts on Monday.

column4: UPS to hire up to 95 000 workers for holiday season
column5: CHICAGO United Parcel Service Inc  plans to hire up to 95 000 workers to handle additional business during the holiday season this year  the package delivery company said on Tuesday.

column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Md. Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp   on Monday said it is working closely with suppliers to prepare for a large ramp-up in production in coming years of the F135 engine that powers the Lockheed Martin Corp  F-35 fighter jet.

Disney hires digital  consumer executives for new TV roles
column5: The Walt Disney Co on Tuesday named two executives to newly created positions in its Disney/ABC Television Group to focus on digital media and consumer experience at a time when TV viewing habits are rapidly changing.

column4: Taco Bell joins fast-food booze bandwagon with new U.S. eateries
column5: Yum Brands Inc's <YUM.N > Taco Bell chain next week will debut a new restaurant concept that dumps the drive-thru and brings on the booze as it seeks to appeal to hip  young city dwellers and fend off popular rival Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc .
